instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: imac 820-3588-A keeps beeping with or without RAM.
threads.message:
Working on one imac 27. It keeps on beeping with the RAM plugged or without.

VDDSPD at pin 199 of the RAM slot is present 3V3.

PPDDRVTT is also present 0V75.

I am wondering if I am on the right direction. Please need a quick answer!!

Greeting

threads.title: imac 820-3588-A keeps beeping with or without RAM.
threads.message:
both slots beeping or just one?

is it 3 beeps?

threads.title: imac 820-3588-A keeps beeping with or without RAM.
imac 820-3588-A keeps beeping with or without RAM.
threads.message: One beep or 3 beeps? Using DDRL RAM?

threads.title: imac 820-3588-A keeps beeping with or without RAM.
threads.message: One beep then stop then one beep then stop continuously. I wanted to upload a video when to see that, but it is not possible as I see..44

threads.title: imac 820-3588-A keeps beeping with or without RAM.
threads.message:
buy one of this, if some led doesn't lit up then you have bad soldering joints

threads.title: imac 820-3588-A keeps beeping with or without RAM.
threads.message: I need some troubleshooting method by use of the schematics Alan L. Not a try and error way. But thanks anyway for trying to help.

threads.title: imac 820-3588-A keeps beeping with or without RAM.
threads.message: One beep can pretty much be anything. It can be not recognizing RAM but it can be 100 other things. Any history on this machine?

threads.title: imac 820-3588-A keeps beeping with or without RAM.
threads.message:
Customers was using it and power it off next day didn't want to come on only beep.

Can you just give me an indication where to begin with troubleshooting? At which stage should we begin with testing signals?

threads.title: imac 820-3588-A keeps beeping with or without RAM.
threads.message: The only thing you can do is diode mode/resistance to GND/voltage on both SMBUS_PCH lines.

threads.title: imac 820-3588-A keeps beeping with or without RAM.
threads.message: what kind of voltage do I expect there on SMBUS_PCH_CLK and SMBUS_PCH_DATA?

threads.title: imac 820-3588-A keeps beeping with or without RAM.
imac 820-3588-A keeps beeping with or without RAM.
threads.message: I asked more than just voltage.....

threads.title: imac 820-3588-A keeps beeping with or without RAM.
imac 820-3588-A keeps beeping with or without RAM.
threads.message: Correction on the above information concerning the VTT voltage, it is 0V67 instead of 0V75. Will it matter?

threads.title: imac 820-3588-A keeps beeping with or without RAM.
threads.message:
0V67 is fine as that is half of 1.35V for the DDRL RAM.

How can I be more specific if I ask for diode mode and resistance to ground on both SMBUS_PCH lines?
